segment.source: Add multiple sites to your Enterprise Mode site list using a file and the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager (schema v.2).
segment.target: Add multiple sites to your Enterprise Mode site list using a file and the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager (schema v.2).

segment.source: Add multiple sites to the Enterprise Mode site list using a file and the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager (schema v.2) (Internet Explorer 11 for IT Pros)
segment.target: Add multiple sites to the Enterprise Mode site list using a file and the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager (schema v.2) (Internet Explorer 11 for IT Pros)

segment.source: Add multiple sites to the Enterprise Mode site list using a file and the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager (schema v.2)
segment.target: Add multiple sites to the Enterprise Mode site list using a file and the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager (schema v.2)

segment.source: Applies to:
segment.target: Applies to:

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows 8.1
segment.target: Windows 8.1

segment.source: Windows 7
segment.target: Windows 7

segment.source: You can add multiple sites to your Enterprise Mode site list by creating a custom text (TXT) or Extensible Markup Language (XML) file of problematic sites and then adding it in the Bulk add from file area of the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager (schema v.2).
segment.target: You can add multiple sites to your Enterprise Mode site list by creating a custom text (TXT) or Extensible Markup Language (XML) file of problematic sites and then adding it in the Bulk add from file area of the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager (schema v.2).

segment.source: You can only add specific URLs, not Internet or Intranet Zones.
segment.target: You can only add specific URLs, not Internet or Intranet Zones.

segment.source: To add your websites one at a time, see Add sites to the Enterprise Mode site list using the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager (schema v.2).
segment.target: To add your websites one at a time, see Add sites to the Enterprise Mode site list using the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager (schema v.2).

segment.source: Create an Enterprise Mode site list (TXT) file
segment.target: Create an Enterprise Mode site list (TXT) file

segment.source: You can create and use a custom text file with the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager (schema v.2) to add multiple sites to your Enterprise Mode site list at the same time.
segment.target: You can create and use a custom text file with the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager (schema v.2) to add multiple sites to your Enterprise Mode site list at the same time.

segment.source: Important:
segment.target: Important:

segment.source: This text file is only lets you add multiple sites at the same time.
segment.target: This text file is only lets you add multiple sites at the same time.

segment.source: You can’t use this file to deploy Enterprise Mode into your company.
segment.target: You can’t use this file to deploy Enterprise Mode into your company.

segment.source: You must separate each site using commas or carriage returns.
segment.target: You must separate each site using commas or carriage returns.

segment.source: For example:
segment.target: For example:

segment.source: -OR-
segment.target: -OR-

segment.source: Create an Enterprise Mode site list (XML) file using the v.2 version of the Enterprise Mode schema
segment.target: Create an Enterprise Mode site list (XML) file using the v.2 version of the Enterprise Mode schema

segment.source: You can create and use a custom XML file with the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager (schema v.2) to add multiple sites to your Enterprise Mode site list at the same time.
segment.target: You can create and use a custom XML file with the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager (schema v.2) to add multiple sites to your Enterprise Mode site list at the same time.

segment.source: Each XML file must include:
segment.target: Each XML file must include:

segment.source: site-list version number.
segment.target: site-list version number.

segment.source: This number must be incremented with each version of the Enterprise Mode site list, letting Internet Explorer know whether the list is new.
segment.target: This number must be incremented with each version of the Enterprise Mode site list, letting Internet Explorer know whether the list is new.

segment.source: Approximately 65 seconds after Internet Explorer 11 starts, it compares your site list version to the stored version number.
segment.target: Approximately 65 seconds after Internet Explorer 11 starts, it compares your site list version to the stored version number.

segment.source: If your file has a higher number, the newer version is loaded.
segment.target: If your file has a higher number, the newer version is loaded.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: After this check, IE11 won’t look for an updated list again until you restart the browser.
segment.target: After this check, IE11 won’t look for an updated list again until you restart the browser.

segment.source: compat-mode tag.
segment.target: compat-mode tag.

segment.source: This tag specifies what compatibility setting are used for specific sites or domains.
segment.target: This tag specifies what compatibility setting are used for specific sites or domains.

segment.source: open-in tag.
segment.target: open-in tag.

segment.source: This tag specifies what browser opens for each sites or domain.
segment.target: This tag specifies what browser opens for each sites or domain.

segment.source: Enterprise Mode v.2 XML schema example
segment.target: Enterprise Mode v.2 XML schema example

segment.source: The following is an example of what your XML file should look like when you’re done adding your sites.
segment.target: The following is an example of what your XML file should look like when you’re done adding your sites.

segment.source: For more info about how to create your XML file, see Enterprise Mode schema v.2 guidance.
segment.target: For more info about how to create your XML file, see Enterprise Mode schema v.2 guidance.

segment.source: In the above example, the following is true:
segment.target: In the above example, the following is true:

segment.source: cpandl.com, as the main domain, must use IE8 Enterprise Mode.
segment.target: cpandl.com, as the main domain, must use IE8 Enterprise Mode.

segment.source: However, bing.com/images must use IE7 Enterprise Mode.
segment.target: However, bing.com/images must use IE7 Enterprise Mode.

segment.source: contoso.com, and all of its domain paths, can use the default compatibility mode for the site.
segment.target: contoso.com, and all of its domain paths, can use the default compatibility mode for the site.

segment.source: To make sure your site list is up-to-date; wait 65 seconds after opening IE and then check that the value in the registry key matches the version number in your file.
segment.target: To make sure your site list is up-to-date; wait 65 seconds after opening IE and then check that the value in the registry key matches the version number in your file.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: If is not set or is wrong, it means that the XML parsing failed.
segment.target: If is not set or is wrong, it means that the XML parsing failed.

segment.source: This can mean that the XML file isn’t there, that there are access problems, or that the XML file format is wrong.
segment.target: This can mean that the XML file isn’t there, that there are access problems, or that the XML file format is wrong.

segment.source: Don’t manually change the registry setting.
segment.target: Don’t manually change the registry setting.

segment.source: You must make your changes to your site list and then update the list using the import function in the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager (schema v.2).
segment.target: You must make your changes to your site list and then update the list using the import function in the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager (schema v.2).

segment.source: Add multiple sites to the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager (schema v.2)
segment.target: Add multiple sites to the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager (schema v.2)

segment.source: After you create your .xml or .txt file, you can bulk add the sites to the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager (schema v.2).
segment.target: After you create your .xml or .txt file, you can bulk add the sites to the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager (schema v.2).

segment.source: To add multiple sites
segment.target: To add multiple sites

segment.source: In the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager (schema v.2), click Bulk add from file.
segment.target: In the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager (schema v.2), click Bulk add from file.

segment.source: Go to your site list (either .txt or .xml) to add the included sites to the tool, and then click Open.
segment.target: Go to your site list (either .txt or .xml) to add the included sites to the tool, and then click Open.

segment.source: Each site is validated and if successful, added to the global site list when you click OK to close the menu.
segment.target: Each site is validated and if successful, added to the global site list when you click OK to close the menu.

segment.source: If a site doesn’t pass validation, you can try to fix the issues or pick the site and click Add to list to ignore the validation problem.
segment.target: If a site doesn’t pass validation, you can try to fix the issues or pick the site and click Add to list to ignore the validation problem.

segment.source: For more information about fixing validation problems, see Fix validation problems using the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager.
segment.target: For more information about fixing validation problems, see Fix validation problems using the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager.

segment.source: Click OK to close the Bulk add sites to the list menu.
segment.target: Click OK to close the Bulk add sites to the list menu.

segment.source: On the File menu, click Save to XML, and save your file.
segment.target: On the File menu, click Save to XML, and save your file.

segment.source: You can save the file locally or to a network share.
segment.target: You can save the file locally or to a network share.

segment.source: However, you must make sure you deploy it to the location specified in your registry key.
segment.target: However, you must make sure you deploy it to the location specified in your registry key.

segment.source: For more information about the registry key, see Turn on Enterprise Mode and use a site list.
segment.target: For more information about the registry key, see Turn on Enterprise Mode and use a site list.

segment.source: Next steps
segment.target: Next steps

segment.source: After you’ve added all of your sites to the tool and saved the file to XML, you can configure the rest of the Enterprise Mode functionality to use it.
segment.target: After you’ve added all of your sites to the tool and saved the file to XML, you can configure the rest of the Enterprise Mode functionality to use it.

segment.source: You can also turn Enterprise Mode on locally, so your users have the option to use Enterprise Mode on individual websites from the Tools menu.
segment.target: You can also turn Enterprise Mode on locally, so your users have the option to use Enterprise Mode on individual websites from the Tools menu.

segment.source: For more information, see Turn on local control and logging for Enterprise Mode.
segment.target: For more information, see Turn on local control and logging for Enterprise Mode.

segment.source: Related topics
segment.target: Related topics

segment.target: Download the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager (schema v.2)
